alert.note: Alert for Surry; Wilkes; Yadkin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Surry, northeastern Wilkes, and western Yadkin counties through 445 PM EDT... At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Roaring River, or near Ronda, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elkin... Fairview... Jonesville... Boonville... Ronda... Traphill... and Crutchfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
